issue.body:
I'm pretty sure this is not default behaviour as when using a time axis scale with a bar chart, the bars overlap. If you compare this to a standard bar chart the bars would shrink in size. The screen shots are taken from the samples.

**Resized**
![resized](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/341852/14739823/1fc36176-0882-11e6-8304-90c03fc5ad7c.png)

**Overlapping**
![overlapped](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/341852/14739824/1fc3d034-0882-11e6-9671-e8e9ceecd568.png)

As far as I can work out I believe it could be to do with the calculation of the width based on the number of ticks. As the ticks are reduced on the time version to fit the label in the calculation should really still use the number of points. But so far I have not manage to find the exact location in the source.

John

body:
I know the problem but I don't know yet how to fix it. Essentially what happens is that initially the scale is in a unit like 'hours'. But then, the unit moves up to something like 'days'. When that happens, the tick is moved to the start of the new unit but the size of the scale in the underlying unit is not increased.

For instance, in the line-time-point-data.html sample file
1. Starting point is initially '5PM'
2. Shrinking the graph far enough leads to unit becoming 'days'
3. The old and new graphs are still exactly 5 days wide, but that's the problem. The new graph is actually larger because the first tick was rounded to the start of the day and the last tick was rounded to the end of the day. So we need to up the width in scale units by that differential amount

Thank you @etimberg for your quick answer

I temporarily fixed the problem by adding some entries with 0 value to the dataset, for 'day' unit I had to add 7 entries, and for the 'week' unit 1. I hope this will help.
